articles.headline: Pipe Made in India Incenses Illinois Town
articles.snippet: Unions began to widen their efforts against imported steel after a train’s foreign freight for an oil pipeline project was spotted in Granite City, Ill.
articles.abstract: Unions began to widen their efforts against imported steel after a train’s foreign freight for an oil pipeline project was spotted in Granite City, Ill.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRANITE CITY, Ill.  Jeff Rains, a retired steelworker at the sprawling mill here, made the discovery. Out walking a month ago, he waited impatiently at a rail crossing while a freight train slowly passed, its flatbed cars stacked with steel pipes, each wide enough for a child to crawl through. Then he noticed “Made in India” stenciled on the pipes.

articles.headline: U.S. Won’t Cite China Over Its Currency
articles.snippet: The Obama administration declined to cite China as a country manipulating its currency to gain unfair trade advantages.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration declined to cite China as a country manipulating its currency to gain unfair trade advantages.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department said on Wednesday that China was not manipulating its currency to increase its exports, a big retreat from the criticism expressed by Timothy F. Geithner in January during his Senate confirmation hearing to become the Treasury secretary.

articles.headline: The Quest to Shrink the S.L.R.
articles.snippet: Canon and Nikon introduce similar mini-S.L.R.’s, but with marked differences once you look closely.
articles.abstract: Canon and Nikon introduce similar mini-S.L.R.’s, but with marked differences once you look closely.
articles.lead_paragraph: Physics can be such a bummer, you know? Those doggone rules of nature make our luggage heavy, melt polar ice caps and conspire to make the toast land jelly side down.

articles.headline: Deals Help China Expand Sway in Latin America
articles.snippet: China’s loans are locking in access to natural resources and filling a vacuum of influence from the U.S.
articles.abstract: China’s loans are locking in access to natural resources and filling a vacuum of influence from the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela  As Washington tries to rebuild its strained relationships in Latin America, China is stepping in vigorously, offering countries across the region large amounts of money while they struggle with sharply slowing economies, a plunge in commodity prices and restricted access to credit.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Alexei Barrionuevo

articles.headline: Officials Say U.S. Wiretaps Exceeded Law
articles.snippet: There was an “overcollection” of domestic e-mails and calls of Americans by the N.S.A., officials said.
articles.abstract: There was an “overcollection” of domestic e-mails and calls of Americans by the N.S.A., officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The National Security Agency intercepted private e-mail messages and phone calls of Americans in recent months on a scale that went beyond the broad legal limits established by Congress last year, government officials said in recent interviews.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and James Risen

articles.headline: Video Prank at Domino’s Taints Brand
articles.snippet: A video prank two Domino’s Pizza employees posted online has shown how social media has the reach and speed to turn tiny incidents into marketing crises.
articles.abstract: A video prank two Domino’s Pizza employees posted online has shown how social media has the reach and speed to turn tiny incidents into marketing crises.
articles.lead_paragraph: When two Domino’s Pizza employees filmed a prank in the restaurant’s kitchen, they decided to post it online. In a few days, thanks to the power of social media, they ended up with felony charges, more than a million disgusted viewers, and a major company facing a public relations crisis.

articles.headline: Unsure of Saturn’s Fate, Dealerships Are Closing
articles.snippet: General Motors has urged Saturn dealers to be patient as it explores selling or spinning off the brand.
articles.abstract: General Motors has urged Saturn dealers to be patient as it explores selling or spinning off the brand.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Saturn, one of three brands that General Motors plans to drop, has been running ads that tell skittish car shoppers, “We’re still here.”

articles.headline: Delphi Faces a Deadline on G.M. Aid
articles.snippet: The auto parts supplier was expected to emerge quickly from bankruptcy, as it is said G.M. would if it filed, but that has not been the case.
articles.abstract: The auto parts supplier was expected to emerge quickly from bankruptcy, as it is said G.M. would if it filed, but that has not been the case.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Delphi filed for bankruptcy in the fall of 2005, a management team led by the seasoned turnaround executive Robert S. Miller Jr., set a goal to shepherd the auto parts maker out of the courts by the middle of 2007.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Banking Industry Showing Signs of a Recovery
articles.snippet: Despite a wave of profits, tough times may not be over, and banks are setting aside money for future loan losses.
articles.abstract: Despite a wave of profits, tough times may not be over, and banks are setting aside money for future loan losses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just three short months ago, many of the nation’s biggest banks were on life support.
